                                              Account Management

                                              Learn how to view and edit account information
                                              • Account Management

                                              Account Setting

                                              Change your password

                                              To change your password, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Hover over your avatar to reveal the dropdown menu and click Edit Your Profile.

                                              3. Choose from the left menu.

                                              4. Fill in the form to change your password.

                                              Recover your password

                                              To recover your password, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Click here to go to the recovery form.

                                              2. Fill in your account email and submit the form.

                                              3. An email with instructions to recover your password will be sent to you within couple minutes. It might take a little longer in some unusual cases, but should not take more than 1 hour.

                                              4. Follow the instructions in the email to recover your password.

                                              Update contact information

                                              To update your contact information, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Hover over your avatar to reveal the dropdown menu and click Edit Your Profile.

                                              3. Fill in the form and submit the changes.

                                              Change payment information

                                              Payment information is very important please take all precautions to make sure you have entered all correct information. To change your payment information, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Hover over your avatar to reveal the dropdown menu and click Edit Your Profile.

                                              3. Choose from left menu.

                                              4. Fill in the form to change your payment information. The form contains following fields:

                                                • Payment Options: This field specifies how ClickLion sends you payments. There are two options: Pay Direct and Transfer to Wallet. If you choose Pay Direct, ClickLion will issue payments via Paypal. Bank Transfer will be available to publisher who earn more than $10,000 a month. With Transfer to Wallet option ClickLion will send funds to your wallet, in which you can then use to pay for advertisement or withdraw anytime you chooses.

                                                • Paypal Email: Your Paypal Account for ClickLion payments.

                                                • Bank Account: Necessary information in order for us to wire payments to you.

                                              5. Submit the form to save your information.

                                              Your information is secured, and we will not disclose any payment information to third parties.

                                              Your Wallet

                                              Add funds to your wallet

                                              To purchase a campaign, you need to have funds in your wallet. To add funds to your wallet, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Hover over your avatar to reveal the dropdown menu and click Edit Your Profile.

                                              3. Choose from the left menu.

                                              4. Fill in the Add Money to Your Balance form.

                                              5. Click Pay with Card to proceed.

                                              Every time you successfully add funds to your wallet, a transaction record will be created to represent your action. Learn more on transaction types.

                                              Withdraw funds from your wallet

                                              To withdraw funds from your wallet, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Hover over your avatar to reveal the dropdown menu and click Edit Your Profile.

                                              3. Choose from the left menu.

                                              4. Fill in the Withdraw form.

                                              5. Click Withdraw to proceed.

                                              Your minimum withdrawal amount is $100. In case the amount is smaller than $10,000, your withdrawn money will be transfered to your Paypal, otherwise it will be wire-transfered directly to your bank account.

                                              Every time you successfully withdraw funds from your wallet, a transaction record classified as payout will be created to represent your action. Learn more on transaction types.

                                              Pay for your campaign

                                              TO-DO

                                              Your Transaction List

                                              To access your transaction, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Hover over your avatar to reveal the dropdown menu and click Edit Your Profile.

                                              3. Choose from the left menu.

                                              You should see a table of transaction which contains following columns:

                                              • Date: The date that the transaction is created.

                                              • Description: Description of the transaction.

                                              • Type: Type of the transaction. There are many types of transaction in ClickLion, learn more.

                                              • Status: Current status of the transaction. Learn more about transaction status.

                                              • Amount: The amount of money for that transaction.

                                              Transaction table is read-only. History can't be rewriten!

                                              Privacy and Security

                                              Does ClickLion collect information from my site?

                                              TO-DO

                                              What does ClickLion do with my personal information?

                                              • ClickLion uses user names in its interface and email.

                                              • ClickLion uses emails and encrypted passwords to authorize users.

                                              • ClickLion uses Paypal emails to issue payments and process withdrawals.

                                              • ClickLion uses bank account information (name, country, bank name, swift code, account number) to make payments and withdrawals.

                                              • ClickLion uses website information (mark up, stylesheet, image and content) to prepare recommendations.

                                              Campaign and Article Management

                                              Learn how to create and manage campaigns
                                              • Campaign and Article Management

                                              Advertiser Interface

                                              Access the advertiser interface

                                              Advertiser section is where advertisers do most of their campaigns management works. To access Advertiser section, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Click Advertiser on top navigation bar.

                                              Advertiser Interface

                                              On the left menu of advertiser interface, there are two sections and .

                                              Your campaigns

                                              When you access Campaigns section, you will see a table listing all your campaigns along with the campaign's information. Those information are: status, total budget, daily budget, impression, page view, click, CTR, start date, and end date.

                                              Click the small icon at the end of each row to go to report page for this campaign.

                                              Learn more about campaign status.

                                              Create campaign

                                              Please go here to learn how to create a campaign.

                                              How to setup a campaign to get valuable visitors?

                                              To setup a campaign, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. In Advertiser section on top navigation, click to open the campaign form.

                                              3. Fill in the following fields and submit the form:

                                                • Name: Name your campaign. This field does not affect campaign performance.

                                                • Budget Spending: This is how ClickLion uses your campaign budget to attract visitors. There are two options fast and evenly. With fast option, ClickLion will try to spend your budget in the quickest possible time. With evenly, you are required to fill in Duration of your campaign, the budget will be split the across the Duration of the campaign.

                                                • Start Date: This is the date on which the campaign should start running. The start date have to be two days current of the current date; for example, if today is Jan 20th, 2015 (UTC +0), a Start Date earlier than Jan 22nd, 2015 (UTC +0) will not be allowed. The two day timeframe, is reserved for ClickLion to collect, prepare and carefully review your campaign and its articles. In some special cases, your campaign will take longer to start.

                                                • Duration: This field is required only when you choose the option evenly for Budget Spending.

                                                • Total Budget: The budget for your campaign.

                                                • Maximum CPC: The maximum amount of money you want to spend per click. The more you are willing to spend, the higher the quality of visitors you can receive.

                                                • How do you want us to collect your articles?There are two options automatic and manual. With the automatic option, ClickLion will automatically go to your website to collect every articles in your website (Learn more on this). With manual option, you will need to add article to your campaign via our Manage Manual Campaign interface. The automatic option is recommended because it saves you a lot of time, and allows ClickLion to automatically update your campaign if you have new articles or made changes to an existing one.

                                                • Domain: Domain of your website for this campaign. The domain URL must include protocol (http, https). For example: http://clicklion.com is a valid domain while clicklion.com is invalid.

                                              4. If your campaign is successfully created, our system will redirect you the campaign's page. If you see an error messages, please follow the instructions and resubmit your form.

                                              5. Upon creation the campaign status will be unpaid. You need pay for that campaign before it can become active.

                                                • If you choose automatic articles collection, ClickLion might need to some time (up to 24 hours) to finish collecting the articles and send you a notification email. After you received that email, please review the articles and purchase the campaign if you think ClickLion collected the articles correctly, otherwise please contact us for supports.

                                                • If you choose your campaign to be manual, you should start adding articles to your campaign. After that please purchase the campaign.

                                                There is a warning about the purchase due date such as Please purchase your campaign before 06-10-2015. If you are not able to purchase the campaign on time, you will have to reconfigure the campaign before purchasing it.

                                              6. The campaign will be reviewed by ClickLion staffs. If it is approved, the campaign will be active by on the Start Date. In case the campaign is disapproved, the Budget will be returned to your Wallet. Learn more about your Wallet.

                                              Paying for your campaign

                                              To pay your campaign, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account

                                              2. In theAdvertiser section, choose a campaign you want to purchase from campaign table.

                                                An unpaid campaign will have a status like so

                                              3. In campaign page, click the Pay button to proceed.

                                                In case your balance is insufficient, this action will take you to wallet page to add money into your balance.

                                              Reconfiguring your campaigns

                                              To reconfigure your campaign, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account

                                              2. Click Advertiser on top navigation bar, you will see a table of your campaigns.

                                              3. Select which campaign you want to reconfigure. A campaign can be reconfigured when it is unpaid.

                                                An unpaid campaign will have a status like so

                                              4. In campaign page, click the Config button to proceed.

                                                • In the campaign's configuration page, you can change the campaign's properties: name, budget, cpc, duration, starting date, ending date, payment method, and articles collection method.

                                                • Remember to click Save to confirm your changes.

                                                Your campaign will not run if your start date is set in the past, you will have to edit the start date in order for that campaign to be active.

                                              Understanding your campaign

                                              Campaign management is one of the most important aspect for advertisers. If you are an advertiser, you obviously want your campaigns to perform as efficiently as possible. You will have to check your campaign's status and knows what it means, we will send an email whenever your campaign's status changes. In this section, we will try to cover everything related to campaigns, its a good idea to finish reading this section to have a clearer understanding.

                                              States (Statuses)

                                              A campaign normally runs through some states. There are totally 6 states that a campaign could be in:

                                              unpaid -> reviewing -> approved -> active -> ended
                    |            |
                    -------------> suspended

                                              1. unpaid: This is the starting state of every campaign. When you see this status, you need to purchase your campaign to get it to the next state.

                                              2. reviewing: After purchasing the campaign, its state will be changed into reviewing. This indicates the campaign is being reviewed by ClickLion staffs.

                                              3. approved: After being reviewed by ClickLion staffs, if your campaign follows our policies, it will be approved and holds this state.

                                              4. suspended: After being reviewed, if your campaign violates our policies, it will be disapproved and holds this state. There will be a message with disapproval reasons which you can see in the campaign page.

                                              5. active: After being approved, the campaign will wait until its start date to be active. When a campaign is active, ClickLion is actually using its articles to recommend to readers.

                                              6. ended: The campaign will move to this state right after it finishes its end date or its budget is out.

                                              While a campaign is being active, it can be suspended by ClickLion staffs if we found anything that violates our policies.

                                              Warnings

                                              While working with campaigns, you might see some warnings on the campaign page. It could be a message telling you that we are crawling your website to collect articles, reasons for its suspension or something you need to do for the campaign.

                                              How often are articles updated

                                              ClickLion will automatically go to your website to fetch your articles. ClickLion will update them once a week. In case you want ClickLion to update your articles more often, please contact us.

                                              Which articles will be recommended on Publishers websites

                                              Articles that follow our policies and are not disabled by advertisers will be considered to be recommended to readers.

                                              Manage your articles

                                              Manage articles interface

                                              To access articles management interface for a campaign, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Click Advertiser section on top navigation, you will see a table of your campaigns.

                                              3. Select a campaign and you wil see a page showing articles of the campaign.

                                              Manually create article

                                              If your campaign is not of auto type, which means ClickLion automatically collects your articles, you need to manually add your articles using ClickLion interface. Please follow these steps:

                                              1. Click Add article, an article creating form will be shown.

                                              2. Fill in the URL of your article and click Parse. To parse your article, ClickLion will have to download contents from the URL and analyze them so it might take up to 10 seconds.

                                              3. In Refine article information, you should see the article title, article image and article body that ClickLion extracted from the URL you put in. If you are not satisfied with the extracted content, you can refine them.

                                              4. Click Submit to create the article.

                                              For images, there are some requirements that your image needs to satisfy, learn more about it.

                                              Disable articles

                                              In case of poor performance or any other reason that you do not want to promote one or more articles, please follow these steps to disable them:

                                              1. In articles table, select the article you want to disable by clicking its image.

                                              2. Click Disable on the top right corner of the table.

                                              Disabling an article will make ClickLion stop recommending it immediately.

                                              View disabled articles

                                              To see articles that are disabled, click View inactive articles on the top right corner of the articles table.

                                              Enable articles

                                              To enable inactive articles, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Click View inactive articles, you will go to a page displaying inactive articles.

                                              2. Select articles by clicking their images.

                                              3. Click Enable to enable them.

                                              Track/untrack articles

                                              Articles are not visible in ClickLion report system by default. To track one or more articles you care about, please follow these steps:

                                              1. In the articles table, select an article by clicking its image.

                                              2. Click Track on the top right corner of the table.

                                              3. To untrack them, click Untrack instead.

                                              Markup Guidelines and Recommendations

                                              In general, our system collects and extracts various kinds of content from your article pages base on their HTML source, also known as markup. In this document, we recommend best practices that you should follow to ensure accurate content collection results.

                                              General Principles

                                              • Please do not use Javascript to generate your content.

                                              • Do not apply any encryption or obfuscation technique to your content.

                                              • We inspect element attributes (id, class, itemprop, etc.) to give a guess of their role on your entire page, so you should name them correctly in terms of their meaning. For example, we will ignore elements which seems to be irrelevant, such as recommendations, article suggestions, comments, advertisements, and so on. For that reason, it is not a good practice adding class="advert" to the article title, or adding class="entry-content" to your recommendations. In shorts, name your attributes exactly after what they do.

                                              Title

                                              • The title of the article should be wrapped within a h1 tag. It would be even more ideal if it is the sole h1 element on the page.

                                              • If a tag name other than h1 is used, you should improve its recognizability by adding meaningful attributes. Some good examples are: class="article-title", id="title".

                                              • It is recommended to keep opengraph title and article title identical, unless you have very special reasons. We do not exactly use the opengraph title as final result, but its content is taken into account as well, so please make sure it is useful enough.

                                              Content

                                              • Paragraphs should be wrapped within p tags.

                                              • The element which contains body text of the article should have self-explanatory attributes with it. Some of the good examples are: class="article-content", id="story-body".

                                              • Irrelevant content inside the article body should be distinguished. For instance, you should never use p tags to write recommendations or suggestions. Also, it is easier for us to filter them out if you can add some descriptive classes to them, for example, class="related-articles", class="recommendations" or something like that.

                                              • If your article consists of multiple sections, please keep the markup hierarchy of each section as simple as possible. Ideally, it should just include informative stuffs like p tags, linebreaks, images, links, etc. If their markup tree is too complicated with recommendations, suggestions, decorating blocks, there is a chance that our system cannot afford to merge all your sections correctly, or the extraction result contains junk texts.

                                              Images

                                              • Please ensure that your article contains at least an image which meets the following requirements:

                                                • minimum width: 320, minimum height: 240

                                                • not a gif image

                                                • width/height ratio is in acceptable range: 320/240 x 0.5 < acceptable_ratio < 320/240 x 2.0

                                                • Images should be embedded using simple img tags with src attributes. CSS background-image and similar techniques are ignored.

                                              Multi-page Articles

                                              We try to collect full text content of multi-page articles. Please make sure that your sub-page URLs are generated as the same URL pattern.

                                              For example:

                                              http://example.com/articles/title/1  
http://example.com/articles/title/2  
http://example.com/articles/title/3  

http://example.com/articles/1?page=1  
http://example.com/articles/1?page=2  
http://example.com/articles/1?page=3  

http://example.com/articles/12345?p=1
http://example.com/articles/12345?p=2
http://example.com/articles/12345?p=3  

http://example.com/articles/12345/p/1
http://example.com/articles/12345/p/2
http://example.com/articles/12345/p/3  

http://example.com/news/a.html/1  
http://example.com/news/a.html/2  
http://example.com/news/a.html/3

                                              Domain and Creative Management

                                              Learn how to create, manage creatives, and implement
                                              • Domain and Creative Management

                                              How to register a domain and start getting revenue from your traffic?

                                              To register a domain as publisher, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. InPublisher section on the top navigation bar, click to open the domain registration form.

                                              3. There are two steps to register a domain. First you will need to declare your domain, second you are required to authorize your ownership of the domain.

                                                1. Fill your domain in Address field. The domain must include protocols (http, https). For instance, http://apublisher.com is valid while publisher.com is not. The domain must not be authorized by any other users.

                                                2. Turn Sensitive on if you allow sensitive content to be recommended on your website. Learn more about sensitive content in our policies.

                                                3. Click Create to register the domain and move to step 2.

                                                4. Download verification code. It is a HTML file containing a secret code for us to recognize the domain.

                                                5. Upload the file to your domain so we can reach it via http://yourdomain.com/clicklion_code.html where http://yourdomain.com is the domain address you registered.

                                                6. Click Verify after you have done all above steps.

                                              Your domain will have status of unauthorized until you complete verification process (Learn more about domain statuses). You can verify your domain anytime you want.

                                              Understand your domain

                                              Domain is where you can add creatives to put it in your website. It's important for publishers to understand their domains.

                                              States (Statuses)

                                              A domain will likely run through some states. There are totally 4 states that a domain could be:

                                              unauthorized -> reviewing <-> disapproved
                          |
                           -> approved ---> (suspended)

                                              • unauthorized: When you registered your domain, that domain will start with unauthorized state. When the domain is in this state, you cannot do anything except authorizing it.

                                              • reviewing: After you have authorized the domain, its state will be reviewing. In this state, your domain is being reviewed by ClickLion staffs. If it's approved, it's state will be approved, otherwise it's disapproved.

                                              • approved: In this state, your domain is ready to run, you can implement its creatives to start earning revenue.

                                              • disapproved: In this state, you should see a warning in your domain page telling the reason for us to disapproved your domain. You can fix the issue and us if you want us to review your domain one more time.

                                              • suspended: In case your domain interferes with our policies, we will suspend it and obviously its state will be suspended.

                                              If your domain is not in approved state and you still implement its creatives on your website. The creatives will show empty recommendation. See more to understand your creatives.

                                              Subdomains

                                              Right nowm, ClickLion considers subdomains as different domains to the root domain. For example, example.com and us.example.com are considered as 2 separated domains. So if you want a creative to be on many subdomains, it's impossible for now.

                                              Multiple subdomains will be supported in next release.

                                              Add creatives to your domain

                                              To add creatives to your domain, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. In Publisher section on top navigation, click on the domain you wanted to add creatives to. If you don't have any domains there, learn more on how to register a domain.

                                              3. Click on Add Creative then choose which style of creative do you want to add. There are two styles Text and Text & Photo. With Text style, your creative will recommend text only articles that have on title. With Text & Photo, it will serve articles with title and image.

                                              4. After you chose one style, a form for you to add creative will show up. Fill in necessary fields and click Save to add the creative to the domain.

                                              Implement recommendation code on your website

                                              ClickLion recommends articles to your readers by executing a script. That script is loaded and run right after your reader visits your website. To implement that script, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Make sure you already have an approved domain. If you didn't, learn more on how to register a domain.

                                              3. On Publisher section, click on the domain you are going to implement recommendation code.

                                              4. Click on a creative in the table. If you don't have any creative, learn more on how to create a creative.

                                              5. Look for CODE SNIPPET section, copy the text in grey box. It's the recommendation code for your creative.

                                              6. Copy and paste that script to your website (every page you want CLickLion to recommend articles to readers).

                                              7. Deploy your updated website to make sure your reader will have ClickLion code in your markup.

                                              Customize your creatives

                                              Each creative can be customized in Edit creative page. There are some basic configurations to customize how your creatives display in your website.

                                              General Configs

                                              ConfigDescriptionValue
                                              Number of articlesThe number of items displayed in your creative.1 - 10
                                              Number of internal articlesThe number of internal article displayed in your creative (less than or equal to number of articles mentioned above).1 - 10
                                              Number of columnsThe number of horizontally divided columns in your creative.1 - 5
                                              Show article sourceAllow source text (example: clicklion.com) to be shown in each creative's article item.yes/no

                                              Widget Configs

                                              Text Creative

                                              ConfigDescriptionValue
                                              Show bulletsShow a bullet before each creative's article item.yes/no

                                              Manual Configs

                                              Check out the following HTML source for further understanding of how to manually style your creative:

                                              Text Creative

                                              

                                              
   
                                              Recommended by
                                              
   
                                                
      
                                              • 
         
            
                                                Article Title Goes Here
                                                
            
                                                Article Source Goes Here
                                                
                                                         
      
                                                •

                                              Text & Photo Creative

                                              

                                              
   
                                              Recommended by
                                              
   
                                                
      
                                              • 
         
            
                                                
            
                                                Article Title Goes Here
                                                
            
                                                Article Source Goes Here
                                                
                                                         
      
                                                •
                                              Classes Definition

                                              • cl-wr: outmost wrapper for creative

                                              • cl-ab: ClickLion About element, holding the ClickLion homepage link

                                              • cl-awoi: list of articles (without image) - use in Text Creative only

                                              • cl-awi: list of articles (with image) - use in Text & Photo Creative only

                                              • cl-bl (optional): show bullets before each creative's article items

                                              • cl-gr-n (optional): divide creative's article items into n columns

                                              • cl-i: article image class

                                              • cl-t: article title class

                                              • cl-s: article source class

                                              Based on classes definition above, you can write your own CSS and override default creative styles by adding your CSS to Additional CSS field in Edit creative page.

                                              Happy customizing!

                                              Understand your creatives

                                              Creative is one of the most important things to publishers. In this document, we will cover a few key points you need to understand about Creative:

                                              • A creative works only in its domain. There is no way for you to share creatives between domains.

                                              • Considering the term domain, a domain and its subdomains are recognized as separated domains. For example: example.com and us.example.com are considered two different domains by ClickLion.

                                              • A creative might show nothing due to the following errors:

                                                • The creative is not running on its assigned domain

                                                • Its domain has not been approved by ClickLion staffs or has been banned

                                                • The reader activity violates our policies

                                              • A creative might show irrelevant articles because we have not finished analyzing your websites. The problem should be fixed as long as we do, but if any issue still persists after 48 hours from the time you implemented recommendation code, please contact us for further supports.

                                              Responsive creative workaround

                                              Glossary

                                              Not sure about some definitions? Learn more here
                                              • Glossary

                                              Advertiser

                                              Advertiser is used to refer to a person who is interested in bringing interested visitors to his/her site and/or refer to a top navigation section which contains advertiser related features.

                                              Campaign

                                              Campaign is used to refer to an entity that advertisers use to plan his article promotion. It is also used to refer to ClickLion report source entity. One advertiser would manage one or more campaigns at the same time.

                                              Article

                                              Article is equivalent to other Content Syndication Networks' content. It presents a content (an article, a blog post, news, announcement, ... as long as it has a title and provide useful information) that advertiser chose to promote. An Article must contain an Article Title and can contain an Article Image, Article Body and Article Publish Date. It is also used as a ClickLion report source entity. Learn more on them.

                                              Article Image

                                              Article Image is an image that best describes the meaning of the Article. Article images are used in recommendation widget (See our recommendation format). Article Image is automatically collected by Lion Collector (Learn more about how ClickLion collects article from your sites) or manually uploaded by advertisers. The image quality should be as high as possible and meets following requirements in order to gain readers attention:

                                              • Image width must be greater than or equal to 320

                                              • Image height must be greater than or equal to 240

                                              • Image ratio acceptable range (width / height): (320/240 * 0.5) < ratio < (320/240 * 2)

                                              • Allowed extensions: jpg, png

                                              Article Title

                                              Article Title is the title of your promoted article. It will be used to display on publishers' websites. Article Title should have maximum of 85 characters for best display. If it's longer than 85 characters, there's a chance that part of the title is hidden behind other Articles in the same recommendation widget.

                                              Learn more on how make your Article Title most attractive to readers.

                                              Article Body

                                              Article Body is some text that used to describe content of the Article. It is used by Lion Matcher to match with users that are interested in the content. Article Body is automatically collected by Lion Collector (Learn more about how ClickLion collects article from your sites) or manually uploaded by advertisers.

                                              Article Publish Date

                                              Article Publish Date is the date that the article is published. We used this information to not recommend readers out-dated content which doesn't have any informative value to them. It is automatically collected by Lion Collector (Learn more about how ClickLion collects article from your sites) or manually uploaded by advertisers.

                                              Publisher

                                              Publisher is used to refer to a person who wants to implement ClickLion recommendation code to his/her website to monetize his/her traffic and/or refer to a top navigation section which contains publisher related features.

                                              Domain

                                              Domain is used to present a website that publishers want to implement ClickLion recommendation code onto. It is also used to refer to ClickLion report source entity. One Publisher would manage one or more domains at the same time.

                                              Creative

                                              Creative is ClickLion recommendation widget that publishers use to implement onto their websites. Publishers can customize their creatives to display the recommendation in the way they want in order to get highest readers attention. Creative is also used as ClickLion report resource entity. One Domain can contain one or more creatives.

                                              Reader

                                              Reader is used to refer to individual person who goes to publishers' website and he/she is recommended by ClickLion.

                                              Transaction

                                              Transaction is an action record created automatically by ClickLion or manually by users (advertisers or publishers) which involves money transferring from a specific source to specific destination.

                                              Report

                                              Report refers to report section on the top navigation bar. It also refers to the performance report for a source entity (a campaign, an article, a domain or a creative) in a specific date range with different frequencies (hourly, daily or monthly). A report contains many statistics on many metrics and intuitive graphs for advertisers and publishers to track their performance conveniently.

                                              Impression

                                              Impression is a report metric used by ClickLion report system. It is counted whenever an individual creative on publisher websites is loaded. If a webpage of a publisher is implemented with 2 creatives, there are 2 impressions counted for that publishers domain if that webpage is loaded by a reader.

                                              Page View

                                              Page View is a report metric used by ClickLion report system. It is counted whenever a webpage of a publisher is visited and loaded by a reader.

                                              Page View is always equal to or lower than Impression for a report source entity. If the source entity is a creative, they are equal. If the source entity is a domain, Page View is likely to be lower thanImpression because when a web page is loaded, Page View is counted as 1 but Impression might be counter as 2 or 3 based on number of creatives implemented on that page.

                                              Click

                                              Click is a report metric used by ClickLion report system. Whenever a reader clicks a recommended article, Click will be counted as 1 for the clicked article, its campaign, the creative displaying that article and the domain of that creative.

                                              CTR (Click Through Rate)

                                              CTR is the most important metric to measure how effective our recommendation is. CTR of a report entity is the number of clicks divided by the number of page view for that entity.

                                              CTR = Clicks / Page View

                                              For example, if your creative received 5 clicks out of 1000 page views, your creative CTR would be .5%.

                                              When the report entity does not have any page view, CTR will be displayed as 0.

                                              Estimated Earning

                                              Estimated Earning is a report metric used by ClickLion report system. It is only available for a few report source entities (domain, creative). For other source entities such as campaigns and articles, see Estimated Spending.

                                              Estimated Earning is an estimation of the revenue you are getting from your domains. Because it is a rough estimation, Estimated Earning might be calibrated later according to our Policies.

                                              Estimated Spending

                                              Estimated Spending is one of ClickLion report metric. It is only available for some report source entity (campaign, article). For other source entities such as domain and creative, see Estimated Earning.

                                              Estimated Spending is estimation of the budget you spent for the campaign. Being an estimation, Estimated Spending might be calibrated later due to our Policies.

                                              CPC (Cost per Click)

                                              CPC is a report metric used by ClickLion report system. It is the average cost of a click and is calculated as:

                                              CPC = Estimated Earning / Clicks

                                              For example, if a domain receives 100 clicks and its estimated earning is $1.5, CPC is $0.015 (15 cents).

                                              If a source entity does not have any clicks, CPC will be displayed as 0.

                                              Displayed Rate

                                              Display Rate is a report metric used by ClickLion report system. It is only available for these report source entities: creatives, articles.

                                              Display Rate of a report source entity is the percentage of number of pageviews that the recommendation is actually displayed out of all pageviews. It may be slightly smaller than 100% because sometime ClickLion is blocked by AdBlock or web browsers are not compatible (Javascript is disabled or ClickLion script is illegally injected).

                                              Payments

                                              Learn how you can manage payment settings
                                              • Payments

                                              Payment process

                                              ClickLion has simple payment process to make it easy for users to receive money from the platform. There are two payment processes.

                                              Payment from a withdrawal

                                              In ClickLion, you can withdraw funds from your wallet anytime you want. When we process the payment, we apply different payment method based on the amount you want to withdraw. If the amount is smaller than or equal to $10000, the payment will be sent to your Paypal account, otherwise we will wire the money directly to your bank account. When the wire transfer is being processed, corresponding transaction of the withdrawal will have status of pending.

                                              Payment from monthly revenue

                                              ClickLion users can choose to be paid directly when his or her revenue is delivered. In this case, if your revenue is smaller than ClickLion payment threshold ($100), the revenue will be still sent to your wallet, otherwise it will be processed as a withdrawal.

                                              Transfer fee, if applicable, is covered by you.

                                              Payment threshold

                                              To avoid spammy withdrawals, ClickLion has a payment threshold of $100. You are allowed to withdraw only if your efficient payment amount is greater than or equal to $100.

                                              Report Interface

                                              Access report interface

                                              Report is an important section in ClickLion. It is the performance insight for advertisers and publishers to improve their performance in the future. To access Report section, please follow these steps:

                                              1. Sign in to your ClickLion account.

                                              2. Click Report section on top navigation.

                                              Report Interface

                                              At first, you will see a blank report with a box to choose the report source entity (Learn more about source entity) and a navigation menu on the left. In the left menu, we have General and Geo report options.

                                              General Report

                                              General report will provide you stats (in many metrics) of a source entity in a specified date range with a specified frequency. To get a report:

                                              1. Make sure you are in General Report section

                                              2. Choose a source entity in the box which displays Select report source

                                              3. If there is no data for that source entity, you will see a notice saying No report data for this time frame, .... Otherwise, you should see the report for selected source entity.

                                                In the report, there are three main parts: main graph, metric graphs and data table. Main graph is a detailed graph for selected metric. Metric graphs is a set of graph that displays many graphs for each metric, you can click one graph to bring them to the Main graph for better view. Data table contains all data for the report which is used to build up those graphs. In that table, you will see many columns that represent metric stats for each time period (Learn more on metrics).

                                              You can change date range and frequency of the report. Date range picker can be found under the source entity box on the left, frequency selector is on the right.

                                              Geographic report

                                              General report will provide you stats (in many metrics) on a source entity in a specified date range for for many countries. To get a report:

                                              1. Make sure you are in General Report section

                                              2. Choose a source entity in the box which displays Select report source

                                              3. If there is no data for that source entity, you will see a notice of No report data for this time frame, .... Otherwise, you should see the report for selected source entity.

                                                The geographic report is basically the same with General report except there is no frequency, everything is calculated on country-wised basis. You can see country entries in the data table instead of a period.

                                              Understand your reports

                                              Metrics and how ther are related

                                              Report refers to report section on the top navigation bar. It also refers to the performance report for a source entity (a campaign, an article, a domain or a creative) in a specific date range with different frequencies (hourly, daily or monthly). A report contains many statistics on many metrics and intuitive graphs for advertisers and publishers to track their performance conveniently.

                                              Report source (your campaign, articles, domain, creative)

                                              Report source is the entity you want to get report for. It can be a campaign, an individual article, your registered domain or a creative.

                                              campaigns, domains and creatives are tracked by ClickLion report system. However, articles are not tracked by default.
